sentences.en: As a matter of fact, she was in a most hopeless quandary.
sentences.cn: 事实上, 她正陷入进退两难的困境.

sentences.en: Carrie hung in a quandary, balancing between decision and helplessness.
sentences.cn: 嘉莉正左右为难.想下决心, 又觉得无助.

sentences.en: George was in a quandary —should he go or shouldn't he?
sentences.cn: 乔治犹豫不定—他是该去呢，还是不该去？

sentences.en: He found himself in a quandary.
sentences.cn: 他发现自己处于左右为难的窘境之中.

sentences.en: He went out to his house in a quandary concerning life and chance.
sentences.cn: 他怀着对生活和命运忧虑重重的心情走回家去.

sentences.en: Her unwillingness to cooperate put me in a quandary.
sentences.cn: 她不愿合作,这使我陷入困境.

sentences.en: His hard little face looked flintier than ever and Scarlett was in a quandary.
sentences.cn: 他这时板着的面孔看上去比石头还坚硬,思嘉进退两难了.

sentences.en: His question placed me in a quandary.
sentences.cn: 他的问题使我有口难开.

sentences.en: I was in a quandary about whether to go.
sentences.cn: 我当时正犹豫到底去不去.

sentences.en: I was put in a great quandary.
sentences.cn: 我陷于进退两难的窘境.

sentences.en: I was put in a quandary.
sentences.cn: 我陷入进退两难的窘境中.

sentences.en: In spite of this, they were in a quandary.
sentences.cn: 尽管这样, 他们还觉得左右为难.

sentences.en: That leaves us in a bit of a quandary.
sentences.cn: 那让我们感到一丝的为难.

sentences.en: The man's request put me in a quandary, I didn't know what to do.
sentences.cn: 那个人的要求使我为难, 我不知道如何是好.

sentences.en: When Hurstwood got back to his office again he was in a greater quandary than ever.
sentences.cn: 赫斯渥回到办公室以后,感到更加进退维谷.

trans.tran_cn: 窘困，不知所措，左右为难
trans.tran_en: a difficult situation or problem, especially one in which you cannot decide what to do
